bdglue2.utility.schemadef

Class FormatHiveAvro

  • java.lang.Object
    • bdglue2.utility.schemadef.Format
      • bdglue2.utility.schemadef.FormatHiveAvro

  • public class FormatHiveAvro
extends Format
    Format the Hive schema meta data based on the assumption that we will be storing data in HDFS as Avro files. It formats the proper syntax to leverage the Hive Avro SerDe that handles mapping this data as external tables.

        public void top(String schema,
                String table,
                boolean noDoc)
         throws IOException
        Format the top portion of the Hive schema file.
        Specified by:
        top in class Format
        Parameters:

        table - the name of the table
        noDoc - unused. Specific to avro.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an IO error occurs

      • bottom

        public void bottom(String table)
        Format the bottom of the schema. In this case, nothing occurs in this method because there is no "middle" either.
        Specified by:
        bottom in class Format
        Parameters:
        table - the table name

      • writeField

        public void writeField(ColumnInfo column,
                       boolean writeDefault)
        Format the "middle" of the schema. In this case, there is no middle as individual fields are not represented in the schema.
        Specified by:
        writeField in class Format
        Parameters:
        column - the name of the column
        writeDefault - whether or not to include default values
